The provided text explicitly states that Catholicism has been a defining part of Portuguese life and that Portugal was "very religious" for centuries under the influence of the Roman Empire and its rulers.  It also mentions that the Catholic Church played a major role in shaping society throughout Portugal's history. While it acknowledges a decline in active Catholicism, the text consistently portrays Catholicism as historically and culturally significant to Portugal, strongly implying it was the religion of the Kingdom.
